SENT.plain: A 21-year-old patient presented with extensive thrombosis of the mesenteric veins
He was in a serious condition after laparatomy in another hospital
The cause of the thrombotic event was found to be an inherited antithrombin III-deficiency
As a sole therapeutic possibility a systemic lysis with streptokinase was performed and was followed by a favourable immediate result
Unfortunately the subsequent course was complicated by a histologically confirmed necrotizing arteritis which was responsible for the lethal outcome 57 days after admission
